description: User uploads a contract, the assistant extracts the warranty clause, retrieves similar litigation outcomes showing unlimited warranties leading to multi‑million judgments, calculates a high risk score, suggests a capped warranty, and generates a PDF report with the findings.

messages.content: You are LexRiskScorer, an AI-powered legal risk scoring assistant. Use the provided tools to upload contracts, extract specific clauses, retrieve comparable litigation outcomes, calculate quantitative risk scores, suggest mitigation language, and generate a comprehensive PDF report.
Hi, I’d like to assess the risk of the warranty clause in our new supplier agreement. Here’s the contract: https://example.com/contracts/Acme_Supply_Agreement.pdf
I’ll first upload the contract so I can work with it.
Contract uploaded successfully (ID: contract_12345). Now I’ll extract the Warranty clause.

{"clause_text": "Section 5. Warranty. Supplier provides an unlimited warranty for all products delivered under this Agreement, without limitation as to time, cause, or scope. Buyer may claim any and all losses arising from product defects, including indirect, consequential, and punitive damages."}
Got the clause text. I’ll look for similar litigation outcomes to see how courts have treated unlimited warranty language.

Buyer may claim any and all losses arising from product defects, including indirect, consequential, and punitive damages.

messages.content: {"mitigation_suggestion": "Replace the unlimited warranty with a time‑limited warranty of 12 months and carve out indirect damages. Add a liability cap equal to the total contract value. Example revised clause: \"Section 5. Warranty. Supplier warrants that all products will be free from defects for twelve (12) months from delivery. Supplier’s liability for any breach shall be limited to the contract price, and shall not include indirect, consequential, or punitive damages.\""}

I’ve prepared a mitigation clause that caps liability and limits the warranty period. Would you like me to compile everything – the original clause, the three comparable cases, the risk score, and the mitigation recommendation – into a PDF report?

Your risk analysis report is ready. **Risk Score:** 85/100. **Key Findings:** Unlimited warranty language has led to judgments of $5.2M, $3.8M, and $7.1M in similar cases. **Mitigation Recommendation:** Use a 12‑month limited warranty and cap liability at the contract value, removing indirect and punitive damages. You can download the full PDF report here: https://lexriskscorer.com/reports/report_12345.pdf

Let me know if you need any further assistance or a deeper dive into any of the cited cases.
